items.title: Zion National Park West Tunnel
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Zion National Park West Tunnel” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Zion National Park West Tunnel course by Pat Fulghum on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Zion National Park West Tunnel course on Kinomap is starts and ends at the Pa'rus Trailhead on the Virgin River, climbing up and descending back down to the Zion Mount-Carmel Tunnel in-between.

The scenery throughout is dominated by deep blue skies, and the sandstone cliffs of the surrounding peaks including The East Temple and Bridge Mountain. Simply breathtaking. The route passes through the tunnel checkpoint, but does not enter the tunnel. Instead the rider spins through 180¬∫, returning through the same setting to the trailhead.

The video is recorded by Fulgaz contributor Pat Fulghum in stabilised 4K, and the scenery looks beautiful. The route timing felt spot on throughout, and the timing of the original filming was at a sensible pace, avoiding pixelation for slower riders (like me!).

This route is absolutely superb - we have added it to our favourite rides section. What did you think? join the conversation below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Zion_National_Park_West_Tunnel.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Zion National Park West Tunnel" hide_columns="2,3" /]

items.title: Greenhill Road to Uraidla
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Greenhill Road to Uraidla” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Greenhill Road to Uraidla presented by Chasing Cancellara course on Fulgaz by Mike Clucas. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Greenhill Road to Uraidla course by Mike Clucas on Fulgaz starts off from the outskirts of Adelaide, and begins with a relentless climb up the longest continuous incline in the area right from the off through the Adelaide Hills. Afterwards the ride drops into Uraidla - from where the route follows a rolling loop interspersed with some very steep climbs - before ending on arrival back in Uraidla.

This ride featured as the first stage in the Santos Tour Down Under event in July/August 2021.

The scenery is dominated by green fields and trees, and blue skies, interspersed occasionally with race furniture from the Chasing Cancellara event. The view never really opens up much on this ride.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot. I struggled to keep up with the original filming speed, though am beginning to find real gains against myself on climbs, courtesy of the switch to the Wattbike Atom.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/2_Chasing_Cancellara_Greenhill_Road_to_Uraidla.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Greenhill Road to Uraidla" hide_columns="2,3" /]

items.title: Ziptrak Seppeltsfield to Tanunda
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Ziptrak Seppeltsfield to Tanunda” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Ziptrak Seppeltsfield to Tanunda course on Fulgaz by Mike Clucas. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Ziptrak Seppeltsfield to Tanunda course by Mike Clucas on Fulgaz is a rolling horseshoe route through the vineyards of Southern Australia, which featured as the first stage in the Santos Tour Down Under event in July/August 2021.

The sky is blue, and the main views from this ride are of the surrounding fields and vines - on this Trek through Southern Australia's wine belt. The route climbs up into the hills to the East of Tanunda, before dropping back down to finish under the race banners in Tanunda.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot. I struggled to keep up with Mike on this ride, partly as recovering from bronchitis, partly as acclimatizing to a new interactive trainer (Wattbike Atom NG), and partly because he is a much stronger cyclist than me! Either way, the video never really suffers from that.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: Namibia Deserts Project - Sunrise in Karas
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Namibia Deserts Project - Sunrise in Karas” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Namibia Deserts Project - Sunrise in Karas course by StevenLeHyaric on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Namibia Deserts Project - Sunrise in Karas course on Kinomap is a flat ride East through the desert in Namibia, into the rising sun.

This course is takes in a 25km stretch of the C17 road between Keetmanshoop and Ko√´s, edging the Kalahari desert. The view is fairly sililar throughout - sunrise, dirt track, desert to either site, and just a couple of other vehicles on the road along the way.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor StevenLeHyaric in FHD, and has been awarded the "Excellent" quality rating by Kinomap. The video is very good, but like any video riding into a sunrise suffers from sun positioning. The low filming position makes the track look fantastic, but also also reduces the view. The timing of the video stutters a couple of times, but in the masin the timing of the video feels very good.

Hope you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Namibia_Deserts_Project_Sunrise_in_Karas.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: Bicycle Road Race Course ? Subashiri over Kagosaka Pass from Yamanaka Lakeside (Tokyo Games 2020)
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Bicycle Road Race Course ? Subashiri over Kagosaka Pass from Yamanaka Lakeside (Tokyo Games 2020)” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Bicycle Road Race Course ? Subashiri over Kagosaka Pass from Yamanaka Lakeside (Tokyo Games 2020) course by Semishigure on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Bicycle Road Race Course ? Subashiri over Kagosaka Pass from Yamanaka Lakeside (Tokyo Games 2020) course on Kinomap is a rolling ride around Lake Yamanaka, followed by the climb over Kagosaka Pass, and concluding with the long descent into Subashiri.

This course is reported to form part of the road race course at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics (in 2021). If so then the peloton is in for a treat, this ride being interspersed between fantastic views across the lake, interspersed by views to the conical Mount Fuji.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor Subashire in full high definition (not sure what Kinomap's FHD means - 2K?). The filming is perfect, and the road looks great, deserving of the "Excellent" quality rating awarded to it by Kinomap. Sadly there is some mis-timing throughout, though worse at the beginning, and more noticeable as our ride was a slow recovery ride..

Hope you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Bicycle_Road_Race_Course_Subashiri_over_Kagosaka_Pass_from_Yamanaka_Lakeside_Tokyo_Games_2020_.gpx"]

items.title: Battle Pass Descent
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Battle Pass Descent” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Battle Pass Descent course by ToeBee on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Battle Pass Descent course on Kinomap is a descent from Battle Pass down to the town of Riverside in Wyoming.

Battle Pass is situated at 3034m altitutude between Bridger Peak and Red Mountain. The route starts slightly lower, on the East side of the pass, descending fairly steadily direct into Encampment, before terminating in Riverside. The scenery is dominated by the surrounding pine forests in the first half of the ride, before the view opens up for the remainder.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor ToeBee in ordinary high definition, and the scenery looks beautiful. Sadly the route is mis-timed throughout, and the camera is not stabilised, with the picture suffereing from bounce throughout.

For us, this is a ride that we won't be in a great hurry to ride again - but if you feel the urge to ride it we would recommend that you ride it in discovery mode, and not in challenge mode. At least that the should take away the mistiming of the gpx data.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Battle_Pass_Descent.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the University of WA to Burswood course on Fulgaz by Richard Stallard. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The University of WA to Burswood course by Richard Stallard on Fulgaz is a flat point to point along the Swan River in Perth WA, starting at th University of WA, and crossing the river towards the end to finish in front of the Optus Stadium.

The scenery is dominated throughout by the views across the Swan River to the high rises of central Perth, with deep blue skies sitting above a tranquil river. The route is flat throughout, rising only to cross the Matagarup Bridge at the end .

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot, it is quite easy to stay ahead of the filming speed on this ride - I did so on a strictly Z1 recovery ride.

items.title: Across Dartmoor
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Across Dartmoor” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Across Dartmoor course on Fulgaz by Rob Bennett. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Across Dartmoor course by Rob Bennett on Fulgaz is a rolling point to point ride across Dartmoor from Yelverton at the West to Dunsford at the East, taking in quaint Devon villages along the way including Princetown, and later Moretonhampstead. The ride formed the second stage of the Fulgaz LeJog event in 2021.

The scenery is starts off well and truly in the mist, and stays that way for the first half of the ride - with occasional animal interjections to keep company. The scenery opens up in the second half of the ride, as blue skies appear with expansive views across the moorland. The route starts off with a steep climb up onto the moor, and concludes with a steep descent off it, with an additional steep climb after Moretonhampstead.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot, although I struggled to maintain decent speed in the climbs.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Across Dartmoor.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Across Dartmoor" hide_columns="2,3"/]

items.title: Prague - Hvezda
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Prague - Hvezda” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Prague - Hvezda course on Rouvy. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Prague - Hvezda course on Rouvy is a flat 4.5km run loop through Obora Hvezda, a large park outside Prague. The course was a short test of the Rouvy AR Run functionality, which I had not tried out since leaving Rouvy in September in a strop about their increasingly hard line on interactive trainers in races - which I've no intention of upgrading my smart bike to.

The course is completely flat, made up of a series of legs through the forest, all returning in time to the opening in front of a star shaped pavilion in the centre of the park.

The course is really well executed. The video clarity and view distance is superb, and the picture stable in comparison to some of the user content on other systems. The avatar animation likely needs a little refinement - but provides a good focal point in the centre of the picture.

The video is recorded in stabilised 2K resolution. Like much of the content on Rouvy the footage is filmed at a higher speed than will be used in practice - keep an eye out for comedic pedestrians moonwalking as a result.

I hope that you enjoy the run - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Prague - Hvezda .gpx"]

Route Images

Treadmill Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Prague - Hvezda" hide_columns="2,3"/]

items.title: Cape Town city centre to Kalk Bay
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Cape Town city centre to Kalk Bay” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Cape Town city centre to Kalk Bay course on Fulgaz by Adriaan Master and Bianca Le Roux. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Cape Town city centre to Kalk Bay course by Adriaan Master and Bianca Le Roux on Fulgaz is a rolling point to point ride along the northern Cornish coast, starting at the Castle of Good Hope in Cape Town, and crossing the Cape of Good Hope to finish at Kalk Bay. The ride was the first stage of the Virtual Cape Town Cycle Tour on Fulgaz in 2021.

The ride is filmed at sunrise, leading to some orange skies in the early part if the ride. The scenery is dominated by views to the Mountains of the Table Mountain National Park, with a few fleeting but superb views out to sea in the latter part of the ride. The ride starts off with a series of 3 climbs at 5-6%, before returning back to sea level and riding largely flat in the second half.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot, although I struggled to maintain decent speed in the climbs. All videos on Fulgaz are of an exceptionally high quality - but this one really stood out for me.

I hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Cape Town city centre to Kalk Bay.gpx"]

Route Data

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Land's End to St Ives course on Fulgaz by Rob Bennett. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Land's End to St Ives course by Rob Bennett on Fulgaz is a rolling point to point ride along the northern Cornish coast, starting in Land's End, and culminating in the drop down to the promenade at St Ives. The ride formed the first stage of the Fulgaz LeJog event in 2021.

The scenery is a wonderful mix of blue skies, green fields and hills, all broken up by occasional traditional Cornish villages and architecture, and sporadic views out to sea. The drive past Land's End airport is a particular highlight for aviation enthusiasts, and try not to go flying over the handlebars when the big blue van cuts you up at the end..

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot, although I struggled to maintain decent speed in the climbs. The colours in this video really are very very good.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: Brierfield Canal 6km
items.content_html: [table id=1 filter=“Brierfield Canal 6km” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Brierfield Canal 6km route in real life! Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

With two marathons to run in autumn 2021, bar any interning impossibilities in the interim, it was inevitable the InsideRRR would spend much more time being outsideRRR in 2021. So this is the second of a series of outdoor trail and road routes around Burnley, and the North West of England. I may even record some for Kinomap later in the summer, and truly bring the outdoors in.

This route starts at the crossing of the Leeds - Liverpool Canal and Barden Lane in Burnley, taking the canal towpath toward Nelson. The first part of the route is very rural, in contrast to the route into Burnley, heading out past the moored barges at Barden Marina. The route continues along the canal, becoming more industrial as it passes the under renovation Brierfield Mill, before leaving the canal by the ramp near the Nelson B&Q. Next the route climbs sharply up from the canal, onto the Colne Road, where it continues to climb more gradually through Brierfield toward Burnley. The former Primitive Methodist Chapel buildings to the right are a particular highlight, housing the JH Blakey lock showroom, and a weightlifting gym. The final section turns down Windermere Avenue, running alongside the Prairie driving ranges and adjacent allotments on the route back to the start.

Ordinarily for outdoor activities the weather will be variable. This is Burnley however, so the sky will be grey, on a good day it will rain lightly, and on a bad day the rain will be heavier.

I'll use stock photos for the next while, until running feels a little less slow and painful, and will come back to upgrade the images with my own in due course.

I hope that you enjoy the run - let me know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Afternoon_Run-2.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=1 filter="Brierfield Canal 6km" /]

items.title: Burnley Canal 5km
items.content_html: [table id=1 filter=“Burnley Canal 5km” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Burnley Canal 5km route in real life! Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

With two marathons to run in autumn 2021, bar any interning impossibilities in the interim, it was inevitable the InsideRRR would spend much more time being outsideRRR in 2021 - particularly while the chickens occupy the treadmill (don't ask). So this is the first of a series of outdoor trail and road routes around Burnley, and the North West of England. I may even record some for Kinomap later in the summer, and truly bring the outdoors in.

This route starts at the crossing of the Leeds - Liverpool Canal and Barden Lane in Burnley, taking the canal towpath toward Burnley. The first part of the route is very industrial, following the old canal-side mills currently occupied by SACO on the journey in toward central Burnley. After a couple of kilometres we drop off the canal down a steep path towards Thompson Park. Instead of turning right to head down to the park and town, we turn left, heading immediately back under the canal, and follow the track straight to the corner of the green, without taking any of the tracks heading left or right. The final section of the ride takes Queen Victoria Road through some of Burnley's historic back-back terracing, continuing straight over a couple of intersections before eventually arriving at the Thomas Whitham Sixth Form College on Barden Lane. There is a 400m track here, which is very exciting, though I've never worked out how to get in to use it. Turn right at the school, and head downhill, under the railway bridge, arriving back at the start.

Ordinarily for outdoor activities the weather will be variable. This is Burnley however, so the sky will be grey, on a good day it will rain lightly, and on a bad day the rain will be heavier.

I'll use stock photos for the next while, until running feels a little less slow and painful, and will come back to upgrade the images with my own in due course.

I hope that you enjoy the run - let me know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Burnley Canal 5km.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: Portrero to Leo Carillo
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Portrero to Leo Carillo” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Portrero to Leo Carillo course on Fulgaz by Grace Hutton. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Portrero to Leo Carillo course by Grace Hutton on Fulgaz is a flat coastal ride along the Pacific net Malibu, California.

The route starts near California State University, rolling through expansive green fields and blue skies, with La Jolla Peak appearing to the left on the extremes of Point Magu State Park. The hills of the park form a natural left boundary to the ride once it hits the Pacific Coast Highway, with green hills to the left, and sure rolling on to the beach to the left. The rout concludes turning off the highway, and in to the Leo Carillo campground.

The scenery is a superb mix of green hills, crashing waves and blue skies. The group ride makes for a nice backdrop, with chatter in the group throughout.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution. As we were riding a structured workout Fulgaz renders the video at 1.0x - given an average ride speed of 37km/h we would have been much slower than the original recording, which would make the chatter sound a little stuttered!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Today_s_Plan_Threshold-2.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Portrero to Leo Carillo" hide_columns="2,3"/]

items.title: Prettyboy Reservoir Loop
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Prettyboy Reservoir Loop” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Prettyboy Reservoir Loop course on Fulgaz by Rick Norton. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Prettyboy Reservoir Loop course by Rick Norton on Fulgaz is a rolling circuit around the Prettyboy Reservoir in Maryland, USA.

The scenery is a mix of autumnal trees, blue skies and green grass. Surprisingly for a ride that is almost entirely within touching distance of a reservoir, the views to the water are limited to a couple of fleeting glances as the route crosses the water, the best passing under through a fairly utilitarian white steel truss bridge. Also keep an eye out for the Pine Grove United Methodist Church, which is particularly striking against the backdrop.

The route consists of 8 climbs on the circuit, each rising around 40m at typical gradients of around 5%, but maxing out at 15% on one of the climbs. We were on a stuctured workout from TodaysPlan though, so we felt none of that.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution. As we were riding a structured workout Fulgaz renders the video at 1.0x - we suspect that we would have been much slower than the original recording on the climbs, which can introduced comedic pedestrian movements!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Prettyboy_Reservoir_Loop_Today_s_Plan_FTP_Test.gpx"]

items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Hathersage and Grindleford” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Hathersage and Grindleford course on Fulgaz by Steve Markus. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Hathersage and Grindleford course by Steve Markus on Fulgaz is a rolling horseshoe shaped ride through the Peak District starting and ending on the outskirts of Chesterfield.

The scenery is a stupendously good mix of bright blue skies whit white cloud for contrast, green fields, yellow rapeseed, and gritstone buildings. This is an area I grew up climbing in, the only real disappointment being the absence of a view to the edges at Stanage and Burbage, but made up slightly by a reminiscent drive past the Little John in Hathersage.

The video is recorded in stabilised 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot. The colours in this video really are very very good.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: Homeward Bound
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Homeward Bound” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Homeward Bound course on Fulgaz by Jimmy Brown. Please read on to see my thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and my own ride data.

Route Description

The Homeward Bound course by Jimmy Brown on Fulgaz is a rolling horseshoe shaped ride starting and ending in Waterford, Ireland.

The scenery on the ride is largely made up of rolling green countryside and blue skies, interspersed with a ride through the coastal village of Tramore. The original filming speed is just over an hour, so I chose the route to use for a 1h FTP calculation while testing out training plan creation in Todays Plan.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution, recorded at a sensible speed to avoid comedic motions in shot. Indeed the scenery seemed to fly by at pace. The picture is not as stabilised as many other Fulgaz rides, which is probably fine when the screen is some distance away, but leads to a fairly nauseous experience when riding on top of an iPad.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: The Llanberis Pass (OC-189)
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“The Llanberis Pass (OC-189)” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the The Llanberis Pass (OC-189) course on Fulgaz by Peter Kettle. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The The Llanberis Pass (OC-189) course by Peter Kettle on Fulgaz is a tough, hilly, circuit of the Snowdon massif in North Wales.

The scenery is dominated by the mountains and lakes surrounding the route, as well as a number of picturesque villages including Beddgelert. The route starts with a ride through Llanberis, past the mountain railway, and climbing up to Pen-y-pas. After Pen-y-pas the route drops down into Nant Gwynant, and onto Beddgelert and past the bottom of the Nanttle Ridge at Rhydd Ddu. Finally the route climbs back towards Llanberis through Ceunant.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture, recorded at a sensible speed that suffers from non of the comedic movements of characters in the video when the ride speed is significantly different to filming speed.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: 2015 UCI Worlds Course
items.content_html: [table id=2 filter=“2015 UCI Worlds Course” hide_columns=“1” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the 2015 UCI Worlds course in the Richmond world on Zwift. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The 2015 UCI Worlds course is a figure of 8 route in the Richmond world on Zwift.

The route starts in the centre of the course in downtown Richmond. The first half of the circuit is pan flat along the Fan area of Richmond. The route passes three statues at the centre of the wide and open Monument Avenue, returning through 180 degrees at the third statue. This section of the course exists in its own right as a route called the Fan Flats.

The second half of the route drops down to and follows the James River, with the rail line running alongside. After the route passes the grain silos on the riverside the route turns through a hairpin before climbing up a cobbled stretch before looping back to the start. This section of the course also exists in its own right as the Cobbled Climbs Route.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Route Images

items.title: Meran to Terlan Cycle Path
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Meran to Terlan Cycle Path” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Meran to Terlan Cycle Path course on Fulgaz by Klaus Herrig. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Meran to Terlan Cycle Path course by Klaus Herrig on Fulgaz is a flat, easy ride along the river Etsch - Adige from Meran to Terlan in the South Tyrol, Italy.

The scenery is dominated by the spectacular views across the river to the face of the Gantkofel-Macaion. The route starts to the left of the train line, before crossing under a bridge to right side, sandwiched between the river and tracks. A train comes through at one point, but try as you might, it is impossible to keep up with the train. At the end of the ride the route leaves the track at a bridge, turning up into Terlan.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture, recorded at a sensible speed that suffers from non of the comedic movements of characters in the video when the ride speed is significantly different to filming speed. If I was being critical, the picture is a little bleached in places, particularly in the early stages.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: 2019 UCI Worlds Harrogate Circuit
items.content_html: [table id=2 filter=“2019 UCI Worlds Harrogate Circuit” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the 2019 UCI Worlds Harrogate Circuit course in the Yorkshire world on Zwift. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The 2019 UCI Worlds Harrogate Circuit is a rolling hilly circuit in the Yorkshire world on Zwift.

The route starts on the edge of Harrogate, turning right onto the Otley Road to head out of town and into the countryside. The route turns right to head over Oak Beck, keep an eye out for the sharp gritstone escarpments on the way. The route turns back into harrogate, taking in a loop along Cornwall Road, Hereford Road, and Kent road, before climbing back through the crowds along the Ripon Road back to the start.

Highlights include the herds of cows roadside, the flock of sheep, farmers on antique tractors - and a couple of traction engines parked up in the centre of Harrogate.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=2 filter="2019 UCI Worlds Harrogate Circuit" /]

items.title: Greater London Loop
items.content_html: [table id=2 filter=“Greater London Loop” hide_columns=“1”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Greater London Loop course in the London world on Zwift. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Greater London Loop is a largely flat circuit in the Land world on Zwift, with a kick.

The route starts off in the pens behind the Tower of London, making its way along the Thames before turning up to Marble Arch. At Trafalgar Square the route passes straight over, heading up past Green Park to Knightsbridge, before making its way past Sloane Square and back to the river. Here the route enters the underground, emerging straight into the Surrey Hills for a climb over Box Hill. When my wife told me she thought that the underground was a magic place where time stood still, I didn't realise she'd been cycling on Zwift! The route descends Box Hill, and returns to the start over Tower Bridge, and taking in the views of seminal London skyline around the Gherkin.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=2 filter="Greater London Loop" hide_columns="1"/]

items.title: Two Bridges Loop
items.content_html: [table id=2 filter=“Two Bridges Loop” hide_columns=“1”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Two Bridges Loop course on Watopia in Zwift. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Two Bridges Loop in Watopia is a short loop through the centre of the main Watopia island.

The route starts off facing forwards (counter-clockwise) on the beach road in Watopia downtown, facing towards the Volcano. The route heads along the beach before negotiating the esses, taking in the views to the Watopia Alpe. The route drops into the Italian Villas before heading back North alongside the run route. The route bypasses the hilly KOM, dropping back into downtown while taking in the view down to the May Field running track. The route concludes where it started - back on the beach staring at the Volcano.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: Dust In The Wind
items.content_html: [table id=2 filter=“Dust In The Wind” hide_columns=“1”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Dust In The Wind course on Watopia in Zwift. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Dust in the Wind route on Watopia starts off near the Fuego Flats start pens to the North of Watopia. The first part of the route passes through the dinosaurs of Titans Grove, before turning onto the underwater tunnel through the Jarvis tree, and onto the wind farm. The route then passes the airplane wreck on the way to the jungle circuit - where you may wish to stop and change onto an MTB. After taking on the jungle circuit the route retraces steps to the Jarvis tree, but this time continues north along ocean boulevard for a second ride though Titans Grove. The final leg of the route turns out on to Fuego Flats, passing firth through Saddle Springs, then the Canyons and Desert Flats - coming to a close in front of the cave houses.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: Sausalito and Marin Headlands
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Sausalito and Marin Headlands” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the 1. Sausalito and Marin Headlands stage one course on Fulgaz by Mike Clucas. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The 1. Sausalito and Marin Headlands stage one course by Mike Clucas on Fulgaz is a figure of 8 loop climbing over, and back across, the Marin Headlands from Sausalito.

The route starts riding through Sausalito, taking in the views across the bay to San Francisco. Then it climbs atop Hawk Hill and along the headland, before dropping down to Rodeo Bay. The return starts with the climb past Battery Townsley, before climbing back towards Sausalito along the Bunker Road, before coming to a close at the Golden Gate Bridge View Vista Point. The bridge is nice, just not as nice as Erskine.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture. Probably the first ride where we have been able to see the clarity of the 4K video.

The ride formed the first leg of the Bay Area Virtual Fondo on Fulgaz. Click here to see the event organizer's event page, and here to see the results on Fulgaz.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Henley Regatta Race Course row route by TeamWaterRower on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Henley Regatta Race Course on Kinomap is a brief point to point row along the River Thames through Oxfordshire on Kinomap. The route is 2.4km long, in the main surrounded by fairly still water, surrounding green verges and blue sky. The main highlights of the route include passing the moorings on the ride into Henley-on-Thames, and the arrival into Henley-on-Thames itself.

The video is good FHD quality - our main and only grumble is the implanting of the second camera video to the top right corner of the screen. It uses valuable screen estate, and is not needed in our opinion.

We hope that you enjoy the row - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Lauwers Lake” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Lauwers Lake course on Fulgaz by Sander Van Der Wal. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Lauwers Lake course by Sander Van Der Wal on Fulgaz is a flat, easy ride around roughly half of the circumference of Lauwers Lake near Groningen in the Netherlands.

The scenery is dominated throughout by extensive views across the flat terrain, interspersed with the occasional windmill. For a ride around a lake, there is surprisingly few and fleeting glances of the water itself.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture, recorded at a sensible speed that suffers from non of the comedic movements of characters in the video when the ride speed is significantly different o filming speed.

I was longing for a little more lake - a complete circuit taking in the Bantswei crossing, if possible, would have been ideal.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Bavarian Tour - Ismaning-Moosinning-Ismaning” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Bavarian Tour - Ismaning-Moosinning-Ismaning course by Stephan 1975 on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Bavarian Tour - Ismaning-Moosinning-Ismaning course on Kinomap is a picturesque tour of the Bavarian countryside from Ismaning, North of Munich.

The route is a flat circuit, largely through fields, and with a good proportion of the ride on gravel, and interspersed with a couple of notable villages on route - Goldach after about 11km, and Moonsinning around half way. With a high sun, blue skies and green fields, the setting is pleasant throughout.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor Stephan 1975 in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. We thought the video quality was excellent - no timing and stitching issues that can characterise some Kinomap contributor videos.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: Visit the Cutty Sark in Greenwich
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Visit the Cutty Sark in Greenwich” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Visit the Cutty Sark in Greenwich course by Mark_C on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Visit the Cutty Sark in Greenwich course on Kinomap is a scenic tour of the South bank of the River Thames in London, England.

The route starts near West Wickham, and makes its way into Greenwich via Catford and Lewisham. The ride then tacks East along the Thames, which it follows beyond Woolwich, before making its way back towards Orpington via Bexleyheath.

The route is one of big city tourism. Highlights include the London terraces on the way in and out of the city, the Cutty Sark - which is circuited twice, brief glimpses of the millennium dome, the views across the river to Canary Wharf, and also the view across the Thames Barrier.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor Mark_C in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. Other than the odd bit of stitching around traffic lights and junctions, and the hoods being in view, the video is excellent.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Visit_the_Cutty_Sark_in_Greenwich.gpx"]

items.content_html: Trying to finish off all the virtual cycling challenges that I started with Rocco - 4 more rides and just 3 days to go on this final event. insiderrr.uk/courses/c…

items.title: Col des Aravis - Alpes
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Col des Aravis - Alpes” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Col des Aravis - Alpes course by chador on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Col des Aravis - Alpes course on Kinomap is a scenic climb up to the Col des Aravis from La Giettaz, ending with the turn into the car park at the summit..

The route is dominated by views to surrounding high mountains, the Micah capped La Grande Balmaz to the right of the picture on the more jagged and conical face of the Pointe de Merdassier to the left.

This was at least our third ride up the Col des Aravis this winter, and the avid eyed amongst you might spot the we have seen the footage before - which has been cropped from the Tissot Challenge - Alpes route from earlier in the season. The white capped Grande Balmaz ridge a familiar site by now.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor chador in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap. While the video quality was excellent, there are some timing issues with the gpx, particularly after exiting the tunnel..

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Col_des_Aravis_Alpes.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: 45 minutes Fat Burning Indoor Cycling Workout South Tyrol Italy Ultra HD
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“45 minutes Fat Burning Indoor Cycling Workout South Tyrol Italy Ultra HD” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the 45 minutes Fat Burning Indoor Cycling Workout South Tyrol Italy Ultra HD course by Virtualtraining Videos on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The 45 minutes Fat Burning Indoor Cycling Workout South Tyrol Italy Ultra HD course on Kinomap is a scenic ride along the Adige, dominated by the limestone cliffs of the Monte del Orso to one side and the Cima Roccapiana to the other.

The scenery is fantastic, but the ride itself has the feel of one recorded for a timed training video and steady playback. There are timing issue throughout, most noticeable when the cyclists legs in shot speed up and down. There is also a section in the middle where the riverside film is inexplicably replaced by a section of roadside.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor Virtualtraining Videos in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality is excellent - save for the splicing and timing comments above. If you are completing the Kinomap XMASTOUR cycling 2020 event, you'll need to complete it anyway!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_45_minutes_Fat_Burning_Indoor_Cycling_Workout_South_Tyrol_Italy_Ultra_HD.gpx"]

Route Images

items.title: La Route de la Soif part II to Col des Aravis | La Resistance
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“La Route de la Soif part II to Col des Aravis | La Resistance” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the La Route de la Soif part II to Col des Aravis | La Resistance course by bertdekkers on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The La Route de la Soif part II to Col des Aravis | La Resistance course on Kinomap is a panoramic gravel ride along the flanks of L'Etale, terminating with the descent to the Col des Aravis.

The route is dominated by views to surrounding high mountains. Particularly to La Roualle, but with occasional glances to the snow capped peaks of the Mont Blanc range forming the roof of Europe. The blue skies, jagged peaks and green grass form a classic setting, only enhanced by the absence of tarmac.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor bertdekker in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap. We also felt this video was excellent.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the BoraBora Tourist Ride - island tour course by kevinscott on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The BoraBora Tourist Ride - island tour course by kevinscott on Kinomap is a beautiful coastal ride along the east coast of the French Polynesian island of Bora Bora in the South Pacific.

The ride is hugged by the sea throughout, with stupendously good views of blue skies, sun, ocean and steep volcanic plugs. The colourful alley at the beginning of the ride is also a nice feature.

This ride is part of the Kinomap XMASTOUR cycling event. We started the event with Rocco, our Lab/GSD X who loved to sit next to the bike, before he passed away suddenly and unexpectedly - and so we will finish it.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor kevinscott in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap, and the filming quality is excellent throughout.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: Mount Buffalo
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Mount Buffalo” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Mount Buffalo course on Fulgaz by Peter Berlowitz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Mount Buffalo course by Peter Berlowitz on Fulgaz is a long attritious and unrelenting climb into the forests above Bright, Victoria. The route is a long and relentless 7-8% climb, taking me almost two hours to ride, broken only by a couple of areas where the gradient levels a little - the largest of which around the 8km mark..

The scenery is dominated by the rolling forested hills ahead and to either side, with only occasional views to the surrounding peaks, though the vista widens as you reach the higher stages of the > 1000m climb.

I had started the Tour of Bright on Fulgaz before losing Rocco, my Lab/GSD X, very suddenly and unexpectedly, and wanted to complete the events that I had started with him sat by my bike. This was the second and final ride crammed into the last weekend of the event - and easily my toughest and longest ride for some time.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture. Despite this the colour feels bleached throughout, everything looking a little brighter and lighter than feels natural. It was also difficult to keep ride pace close to filming pace, so it was either filmed by something faster than a bicycle, or somebody much faster on bicycle than us!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/3_Mount_Buffalo_Bright_Brewery_Tour_of_Bright.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Mount Buffalo" hide_columns="2,3" /]

items.content_html:
Rocco was always sat by my side as I trained, so I wanted to finish off the events that I had started while he was here.

This is me finishing off the Tour of Bright on Fulgaz, just half an hour before the event closed. Easily the biggest and toughest ride that I’ve done in a while, and an emergency cookie was required towards the end as I started to bonk. Every time I felt drained, I just thought of him and it gave me the strength to carry on. The cookie helped too.

Next up I need to finish off the xmastour on Kinomap, though I’ve a little longer before those events complete. www.strava.com/activitie…

items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“The Tawonga Climb” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the The Tawonga Climb course on Fulgaz by Peter Berlowitz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The The Tawonga Climb course by Peter Berlowitz on Fulgaz is an attrition's and unrelenting climb into the forests above Tawonga, Victoria. The route is a short and but relentless 6% climb, taking me a little over an hour to ride.

The scenery is dominated by the rolling forested hills ahead and to either side, with only occasional views to the surrounding peaks.

This was my first ride since losing Rocco, the my Lab/GSD X who would ordinarily by underneath the handlebars of my bike. To be honest, my heart wasn't in this, but the Bright Brewery Tour felt like something that I started with Rocco, and need to finish. So I'll be back for the third ride tomorrow.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture. Despite this the colour feels bleached throughout, everything looking a little brighter and lighter than feels natural. It was also difficult to keep ride pace close to filming pace, so it was either filmed by something faster than a bicycle, or somebody much faster on bicycle than us!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Beautiful Ride to Rodeo beach (California) course by thereynes on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Beautiful Ride to Rodeo beach (California) course on Kinomap is a trail ride around Hill 88 north of San Francisco, California, culminating in a final descent to Rodeo Beach.

Blue sky, deep blue seas, green foliage and dirt trail - this ride is a little different. The best views of Rodeo Beach and Rodeo Lagoon behind it, are taken from above - accentuating the surf landing on the beach

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor thereynes in full high definition with stabilised picture - awarded the "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap. The picture quality is excellent, though there are a couple of stitching issues - not least after visiting the battery gun that resembles a large elevated sewerage tube!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Citadelle de Lille course by ldesmons on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Citadelle de Lille course by ldesmons on Kinomap is a pleasant circuit around the pentagonal citadel designed and built by Field Marshal Vauban in the late 17th century, and still in service today as the headquarters of the Corps de r√©action rapide France. Read more about the Queen of Citadels over at wikipedia.

The ride hugs the moat to the citadel for the duration, with the red brick walls of the citadel beyond. The route is clearly a popular walking and riding trail, with others on the route throughout.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor ldesmons in standard definition with stabilised picture. The filming quality is good throughout, though outstrips the gpx - resulting in 200m treading on the spot in the car park at the end!

We hope that you enjoy the run - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

The Oosterscheldekering course on Kinomap is a beautiful coastal ride along the Oosterscheldekering delta works from Burgh Haamstede in the North to the harbour at Wissenkerke in the South.

The tour rides along the dike taking in sea, hydroelectric turbines, wind tubines, a small lighthouse, and a pretty harbour at the close. The sky is blue, with a little cloud for contrast.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor bertdekker in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. items.title: Benidorm to Calp
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Benidorm to Calp” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Benidorm to Calp course by Mark_C on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Benidorm to Calp course on Kinomap is a beautiful coastal ride from Benidorm to Calpe in Valenciana, Spain..

The route starts at the Eastern extreme of the Benidorm beaches, climbing inland to circumvent the Sierra Gelada hills to the right. Dropping back to the coast, the ride the rolls beachside through L'Albir and Altea. The route then climbs up past the Sierra de Toix alongside the tram, taking in a couple of tunnels and high limestone walls, reaching a high point of around 130m. From here the route drops into Calp, before doglegging back to the beach for a superb finish dominated by the sharp butresses of Calp Rock rising from the Mediterranean.

The scenery is a blend of Spanish tourist and expatriate resorts, steep limestone walls, blue skies and deep blue seas. Keep and eye out for a couple of large chaingangs flying past, as well as the Benidorm Dealz store which is on route.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor Mark_C in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. Other than the odd bit of stitching around traffic lights, the hoods being in view, and the amount of shadow in picture, the video is excellent.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Benidorm_to_Calp.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="Benidorm to Calp" hide_columns="2,3"/]

items.title: A Cruise Along the Yarra River
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“A Cruise Along the Yarra River” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the A Cruise Along the Yarra River course on Fulgaz by Phil Harrison. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The A Cruise Along the Yarra River course by Phil Harrison on Fulgaz is a ride downstream along the Yarra River through. Melbourne. The route is short and flat, taking a little under Half an hour to ride.

The scenery ride side is dominated by the views downriver to the skyscrapers of Melbourne downtown, framed by the setting sun on a bright evening. The trail is busy, and there are a few occasions where pedestrians on trail will have you reaching for the brake lever! The scenery is a little constricted in the first half of the ride, opening up and improving greatly after half-way.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture. There is some automatic color adjustment that is a little distracting, again, in the first half of the ride, this improves as the ride goes on.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/A_Cruise_Along_the_Yarra_River.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

[table id=4 filter="A Cruise Along the Yarra River" hide_columns="2,3"/]

items.title: Albert Park Lake
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Albert Park Lake” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Albert Park Lake course on Fulgaz by Aidan Buttigieg. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Albert Park Lake course by Aidan Buttigieg on Fulgaz is flat loop around Albert Park. Melbourne. The route is short and fast, and can be looped - the course profile below is from a 5 lap circuit of the lake testing out the group ride facility on Fulgaz..

The scenery ride side is dominated by the lake to the left, and the impressive architecture of the Melbourne skyline to the right and ahead..

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture. The route is let down a little by the weather, on what is a fairly grey and nondescript Melbourne day. This would have been resplendent in the sun.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: Swansea Bay Sprint
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Swansea Bay Sprint” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Swansea Bay Sprint course by WhiteRockEvents on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Swansea Bay Sprint course by WhiteRockEvents on Kinomap is a flat and scenic out and back along the Swansea Bay Cycle Path from Brynmill, to Cinderalla's car park beyond Mumbles.

The scenery is dominated throughout by the sunset views across Swansea bay in both directions, highlights include the view out to Mumbles Pier, and the turnaround at what used to be the car park to Cindarella's... back in 1998!

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor WhiteRockEvents in full high definition. Not sure that the picture is stabilised, certainly not ultra-stabilised, but very rideable all the same. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. The video suffers from a little water distortion in places, but this is Swansea afterall.

Used to feel so much easier after completing the Mumbles Mile... all those years ago.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Kinomap_Swansea_Bay_Sprint.gpx" hide_columns="2,3"]

items.title: Along The River La Romanche
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Along The River La Romanche” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Along The River La Romanche course by gonvil on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Along The River La Romanche course by gonvil on Kinomap is a scenic downhill riverside route in Is√©re, France.

The route starts at Le Clapier D'Auris, dropping along the wooded D1091 to the canalised La Romanche, past the Alpe d'Huez, sitting high in the mountains to the right. The steep cliffs of La Romanche valley open up, with the scenery dominated by the hulk of the Grand Pic de Belledonne. The route drops off the riverside a couple of times before returning, finally crossing a steel bridge to the finish.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor gonvil in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. The video suffers from a little sun bleaching in places, but we thought it was an excellent little route.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: Harrison County Northern Rail Trail
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Harrison County Northern Rail Trail” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Harrison County Northern Rail Trail course by Craig Harrison on BKool. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Harrison County Northern Rail Trail course on Bkool is a rolling ride through Harrison County from Spelter along the Harrison Country Northern Rail Trail, to Clarksburg.

The route is simulated in 3D in the Bkool Simulator, which programmatically recreates the route and area around it. The ride is pleasant, and the scenery in the simulator for rural areas like this is much enhanced compared to rural and coastal routes (buildings and the sea need much enhancement!). None of which compensates though for the fact that what is presumably a disused railway line is presented as the standard Bkool Simulator Road.

Nonetheless, we enjoyed the ride which was stage 2 in the Nov. 2020 Tour of America league run by the BKOOL USA Tour of America group on Bkool. Understanding how groups and leagues work, and how to subscribe to them, is pretty key to getting the most out of Bkool - more of that in a subsequent article.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Harrison_County_Northern_Rail_Trail.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: Cape Cod Canal South Side
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Cape Cod Canal South Side” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Cape Cod Canal South Side course by Scott Mandel on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Cape Cod Canal South Side course by Mike Clucas on Kinomap is a flat, canal-side, across the Cape Cod peninsula in Massachusetts.

The route starts at the West End of the canal, near Sandwich, passing under near identical span bridges carrying the US6 and MA28 roads, before coming to a stop at the bridge carrying the rail line over the East end of the canal near Bourne.

The video is recorded by Kinomap owner Scott Mandel in full 4K high definition with stabilised picture. The views over the canal show its scale, and the bridges are good. The scenery is not as good as many other Fulgaz rides though, and the sky is a rather insipid grey too. A nice ride all the same - but there are more inspiring rides on Fulgaz.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Dune ride Ouddorp course by jasperlok on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Dune ride Ouddorp course on Kinomap is a beautiful sunrise ride along the dunes of South Holland in the Netherlands..

The route starts heading east along the beach riding into the sun, with the dunes and beach to the left. The ride then turns inland before heading back West parallel to the outward leg. Eventually the route turns right to head back to the coast, and to return back to the start via a couple of diversions to take in the views over the beach.

The scenery along the route is a beautiful blend of pale blue sky, green shrubbery, and views out to see over the expansive beaches below.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor jasperlok in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: Santa Barbara Waterfront Cruise
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Santa Barbara Waterfront Cruise” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Santa Barbara Waterfront Cruise course by Mike Clucas on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Santa Barbara Waterfront Cruise course by Mike Clucas on Kinomap is a flat, beachside, ride through Santa Barbara, California.

The route starts on Shoreline Drive, at the Western end of Leadbetter Beach, before heading through a parking lot and out to the marina. From here the route heads along West Beach and then East Beach, before crossing over East Cabrillo Boulevard to follow the Andree Clark Bird Refuge to the finish.

The video is recorded by Kinomap owner Mike Clucas in full 4K high definition with stabilised picture. The scenery ranges from the stupendously sublime, to occasionally mundane, and the slow original recording pace makes you feel super speedy!

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: Tissot Challenge - Alps
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Tissot Challenge - Alps” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Tissot Challenge - Alps course by chador on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Tissot Challenge - Alps course by Chador on Kinomap is a in attritious limb up the Col des Aravis in Haute Savoie in France.

The route starts about half way up the climb from Flumet to the Col des Aravis. The route climbs from the off, rarely is the gradient below 5%, with only a small plateau en route providing a little respite.

The scenery along the route is a sublime blend of deep blue sky, green hills, and occasional views to big mountains nearby.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor chador in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap - though we experienced synchronisation issues throughout the ride which appeared to stem from the speed of filming rather than connection. The ride appears to be filmed from something considerably faster than a bicycle!. We may have had other issues with our ride though, it is not often we find ourselves riding so far off the back.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

Route Images

The Gran Canaria: Forgotten road GC604 course on Kinomap is a beautiful downhill ride into Maspalomas in Gran Canaria.

The scenery along the route is a sublime blend of jagged volcanic rides and buttresses, blue skies, interspersed by occasional views out to sea in the distance..

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor gonvil in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap.

Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the San Francisco Bay Marshlands and Wildlife Discovery Ride course by thereynes on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The San Francisco Bay Marshlands and Wildlife Discovery Ride course on Kinomap is a beautiful ride around the salt marshes of San Francisco Bay in California..

The sky is blue, the sea is blue, interspersed only by the ridges separating the marshes from the seas, and back to the Coyote Hills Regional Park beyond the shore. The route is a flat as a salt marsh too!

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor thereynes in full high definition with stabilised picture. We've not checked the ride quality awarded by Kinomap, usually rides by thereynes achieve "Good Quality", sometimes "Excellent Quality" label from Kinomap - either way, I thought it was superb.

items.title: Tissot Challenge - Jura
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Tissot Challenge - Jura” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Tissot Challenge - Jura course by gonvil on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Tissot Challenge - Jura course by gonvil on Kinomap is an ascent of the Col du Grand Colombier, in the Jura massif.

The route starts in the forests above Culoz, and at a starting altitude of around 900m, around halfway up the climb. The first half of the ride is climbing steeply up through narrow forest. Though the blue skies and green fires make a good combination, views are few and far between. If there were any views from here, they would be looking straight down to the Lac du Bourget which we recently rode.

After the second switchback, the ride climbs out onto open hillside, and though views of the surrounding area are few and far between, the vista becomes much more expansive.

As the second half of the climb comes to an end the route arrives at the summit of the Col du Grand Colombier, which is busy and clad with visitors. In this final section the view opens out to provide a few fleeting views of the surrounding area.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor gonvil in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. We did not experience any synchronisation issues on this ride, save for the hoods being periodically in picture, it is immaculately filmed.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

The Lac du Bourget, southern part course by gonvil on Kinomap is a beautiful ride around the Southern end of Lac du Bourget, in Savoie, Southern France.

The route hugs the shore of the lake, with the scenery dominated by the steep escarpments to either side of the lake - particularly the bladed edge of Mont du Chat. There are a few excursions away from the lake, with a particular highlight being the fairground at the very end of the ride..

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor gonvil in full high definition with part stabilised picture. The quality of the ride has been awarded the "Good Quality" label from Kinomap. There are some synchronisation issues throughout, where the picture stalls as the gpx catches up the video.

items.content_html:
[table id=4 filter=“ToB 2018 Stage 8 London” hide_columns=“2,3” /]

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the ToB 2018 Stage 8 London courses on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The ToB 2018 Stage 8 London courses by Peter Kettle on Fulgaz are a series of closed road circuits through central London with Marble Arch and Trafalgar Square at its heart.

The circuit starts at Piccadilly Circus, heading North along Regent Street before turning 180¬∞, heading back through Piccadilly Circus, and along Haymarket to Trafalgar Square. Next the route heads east along the Strand, past Charing Cross, before again turning through 180¬∞ to return to Trafalgar Square. The last part of the loop heads South along Whitehall, turning back through 180¬∞ a little after Downing Street, back to Trafalgar Square, and beyond to the start at Piccadilly Circus.

The scenery along the ride is dominated by the architecture of the area, especially Nelson's Column at Trafalgar Square, and Marble Arch. Also watch out for the race paraphernalia - not least the kamikaze pedestrians at the various crossing points.

This ride can be ridden in single lap, 4 lap and 6 lap configurations in Fulgaz - or for more freedom, simply ride in loop mode.

The video is recorded in 4K resolution with stabilised and perfectly synchronised picture, with a slight join noticeable in the stitching of the video at the end of each lap.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Scenic Truckee River Legacy Trail Out and Back course on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Scenic Truckee River Legacy Trail Out and Back course on Kinomap is a beautiful riverside ride in rural California.

The route starts at the town of Truckee, heading downstream. As the route nears the town of Glenshire it departs from the riverside, climbing steeply up into the town. The route then follows an about turn, descending steeply back to the Truckee River, and then climbing gently back part of the way upstream.

The scenery along the route is a sublime blend of blue sky, green shrubbery, river, and distant hills, all broken up with a little cloud in the sky..

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor thereynes in full high definition with stabilised picture. The quality of the ride is better than many in Kinomap, and it has been awarded to "Excellent Quality" label from them.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

items.title: The Return of the Pedi
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“The Return of the Pedi” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Return of the Pedi course on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Return of the Pedi course on Fulgaz is a linear tour undulating through the and-dunes of the UAE.

The route consist of a series of 7 sand dunes to climb, starting at Moreeb Dunes, and heading to the town of Liwa. According to Fulgaz we are firmly in Star Wars territory here, with the Force Awakens filmed nearby.

The scenery along the route is a sublime blend of blue sky, and bright golden sand, with white buildings emerging on the horizon toward the end. All resplendent in the brightening dawn sky.

The video is recorded by Fulgaz contributor Harrison Liddle in super high definition 4K with stabilised picture. Like most all rides in Fulgaz, the quality of the video is sublime, with no handlebars or other obstructions in picture.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.title: Plymouth Historic Waterfront
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Plymouth Historic Waterfront” hide_columns=“2,3”/]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Plymouth Historic Waterfront course on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images, and our own ride data.

Route Description

The Plymouth Historic Waterfront on Fulgaz is a linear tour of the town's harbours.

The route starts with a tour of Sutton Harbour Marina, cycling amongst the yachts moored in the harbour. From here the route takes to the foreshore, following a route below the Royal Citadel, and heading toward the striking Smeaton's Tower lighthouse. After Smeaton's Tower the route returns to the water, touring the King Point Marina, then the Royal William Yard. Finally the route turns inland, climbing up to the promenade atop the Hoe, finishing back infront of Smeaton's Tower.

The scenery along the route is a sublime blend of blue sky, deep blue sea, and in places bright green grass. The architecture is striking too, dominated by clean white colonial buildings.

The route is largely flat, the only real climb taking place on the climb up to the Hoe at the end of the ride..

The video is recorded by Fulgaz contributor Rob Bennett in super high definition 4K with stabilised picture. Like most all rides in Fulgaz, the quality of the video is sublime, with no handlebars or other obstructions in picture.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Plymouth_Historic_Waterfront.gpx"]

Route Images

Route Data

items.title: Scenic Bike Paths along Crystal Springs and San Andreas Lakes
items.content_html: [table id=4 filter=“Scenic Bike Paths along Crystal Springs and San Andreas Lakes” hide_columns=“2,3” /]
items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Scenic Bike Paths along Crystal Springs and San Andreas Lakes course on Kinomap. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images.

Route Description

The "Scenic Bike Paths along Crystal Springs and San Andreas Lakes" on Kinomap is a North Westerly ride along the San Francisco Peninsula, starting alongside the Crystal Springs Reservoir and continuing the length of the San Andreas Lake via a strange detour towards Millbrae.

Water is never too far from this route, with the scenery dominated by both lakes, with a stretch of scrubland in-between. Indeed one of the highlights of this route is arriving at, and turning onto, the dam of the San Andreas Lake.

The route is largely flat, with almost all of the climb taking place in the section between the two lakes.

The video is recorded by Kinomap contributor thereynes and carries the "Good Quality" stamp from Kinomap on the route page. It is filmed in stabilised HD and for the most part very good - though handlebars are present throughout, and there is a little lag in places which may have been my shaky internet connection.

We hope that you enjoy the ride - let us know what you think in the comments box below.

Route Profile

items.content_text:
Welcome to the InsideRRR preview of the Packer Park Velodrome course on Fulgaz. Please read on to see our thoughts on the route, course profile and images.

Route Description

Tired after a long start to the week at work, I wanted to get a quick ride in to test out the version 4 beta of the Fulgaz App. Short on time, and only wanting to test basic functionality, what better than a velodrome?

I had not realised there were velodromes to ride on Fulgaz, though there are several motor racing circuits to film from, and at least one other dedicated bike circuit.

The Packer Park Velodrome is a publicly accessible cycle track, in Melbourne, apparently home to the Carnegie Caulfield Cycling Club.

This route is beautifully filmed in stabilised 4K (though we only ride in perfectly adequate 1080p for connection stability (we are a little way from the modem. Though at less than 400m / circuit, it is not a long course. Be prepared to count the cycle club on your way past each lap!

Being a velodrome the route uses the Fulgaz loop function. When we used this a year or so ago, when we last used Fulgaz to any degree, the mapping was a little wonky on Strava, whereas on this route at least it mapped perfectly.

We did not have time to test out the new group ride functionality - we will play with that shortly.

Route Profile

[sgpx gpx="/wp-content/uploads/gpx/Packer_Park_Velodrome.gpx"]
